nodes.bodyText:
Could you make this a construction parameter of SpliceDefaultCompactor instead?
This non final allowSpark only for the sake of tests is a bit scary in my opinion.

We can't make it a constructor parameter because the constructor is called directly by HBase, but I've made it a private non-static final field that gets initialized in the Constructor from the Configuration object.
Can you rename this to CleanupCompactedFileAfterFailoverTest instead to adhere to our naming conventions?

Awesome fix!   So glad this issue is finally understood.  Do you think we need to do something similar in paths that don't use snapshot isolation, for example, table and schema backup, so that the backup doesn't include the compacted store files?

Good point @msirek , we are already doing it for Full backups (see https://github.com/splicemachine/spliceengine-ee/blob/master/splice_backup/src/main/java/com/splicemachine/backup/HBaseBackupUtils.java#L384 ) but maybe we are missing some cases.
@jyuanca do we need the same thing for Incremental backups and maybe table/schema backups?
@dgomezferro Database/table/schema backup excludes all compacted HFiles. If we can make sure compacted HFiles do not come alive after an HBase restart and recover, backup would not copy these files.
